. It includes the villages of Dennis Port, East Dennis, South Dennis, and West Dennis. Dennis bills itself as the "Cultural Center of Cape Cod", and perhaps rightly so. It boasts the Cape Cod Museum of Art, the Cape Playhouse, and some really excellent art and craft galleries.

value: take I-93 south to Route 3 south to the Sagamore Bridge (Becomes Rt. 6). Dennis is at Exit 9 off of Route 6, approximately 40 minutes from the Sagamore Bridge.

take I-95 north to I-195 to Route 25 south to the Bourne Bridge (I-495 also becomes Route 25). At the rotary (traffic circle) on the Cape side, go almost all the way around and travel along the Canal to Route 6 east. Dennis is at Exit 9 off of Route 6, approximately 40 minutes from the Sagamore Bridge.
. They also service the off cape cities of

Public transportation is non-existent in Dennis, so you will want a car to get around. While the shoulders are narrow on many of the roads, bicycles are also a great way to get around in Dennis.

value: Cape Cod Freestyle Frenzy Wind Surfing Competition, West Dennis Beach, mid-June.

, Scargo Hill Rd., (Rte 6, Exit 9 to Route 143 north, LEFT on Rte 6A, LEFT on Scargo Hill Rd). Nice panoramic view of the Cape and across Cape Cod Bay from the top of the 28 ft (8.5 m) stone tower on the 160 ft (49 m) hill.
content= Fine, unusual pottery by various artists, including an outdoor display. Sometimes you can watch them work.
, 444 Route 28, Dennisport, +1 508-398-1600. Summer daily 9:30AM-7:30PM; off-season daily 9:30AM-5:30PM. Your kids will love it. Adults $2.50, children $4.50. Under age 1 free.
name=Josiah Dennis Manse Museum and Schoolhouse

, Off of Route 6A.  One of the most beautiful beaches in Dennis.  Best at low tide, when vast sandbars stretch for miles and the ocean recedes several hundred yards.  Can get very crowded during tourist season: neighboring Chapin Beach is usually less crowded, but slightly rockier.
directions=on the grounds of Cape Playhouse
hours=Tu-Sa 10AM-5PM; Su 12PM-5PM; Th until 8:30PM. Guided Docent Tours: We & Sa at 11AM, Su at 1PM
content= Preserves and displays the art of Cape Cod Artists.
name=Cape Playhouse Center for the Arts
content= America's oldest professional summer theatre.
, Dennis Union Church, Route 6A, +1 508-255-9255 (General Information), +1 508-255-9255 (Box Office).
name=Bike the Cape Cod Rail Trail
content=Route 134, South Dennis. Free parking. This 22 mile bike trail follows an old railroad bed through several towns. Check their website or call them to check for closures.

:Dennis Pines Par 72, 7000 yards.

value: content=Sightseeing Day Tours of Cape Cod. We visit Historical areas, Windmills, Lighthouses, Cape Cod Bay, Harnors, Cape Cod National Seashore, Provincetown, lovely Chatham, Hyannis, JFK Memorial and much more. This is a fun tour and you will see so much of Cape Cod. Provides a nice picnic lunch and complimentry hotel pick up. A Cape Cod " Must Do".
content=Depot St. Dennisport. Top notch dining overlooking Nantucket Sound. Rated excellent by Zagat.
content=(Rt. 6A). Nice casual place right across from the theatre.
content="Beach casual" featuring outdoor raw bar.
content=West Dennis. Great oceanside location, some imaginative dinners. Lousy, small wine glasses. $19-$2Th8.
, Lower County Road, Dennisport.  One of the most popular ice cream shops in Dennis.  A favorite of locals and tourists alike.  Has a player piano and a neighboring candy shop.
content=Route 28, West Dennis. Very affordable local seafood restaurant, known for its excellent fried seafood. Regularly recognized by Cape Cod Life magazine and various surveys.
content=A family-friendly Italian restaurant focused on serving fresh, simple, delicious Italian food in a comfortable, home-like setting where everyone is welcomed as family and friends.
, Route 28, +1 508-394-7416. Seasonal W-Sa. Live bands weekends. Sa 3PM-7PM DJ. 20s-30s crowd.
, 435 Route 28, Dennisport, +1 508-398-1620. Irish music nightly in summer. In fall dancing on Friday and Saturday nights only. All ages.
content=Dennisport. Nightly June-August. For the young and restless. Local blues and classic rock bands.
content=West Dennis. W-Sa features Rock King, who has been a 38-year fixture here.
content=116 Route 28, West Dennis. On Bass River. Young crowd. Rock music in summer. Reggae on summer Sundays.
, 1374 Route 134, East Dennis, +1 508-385-6177.  Where the locals hang out.
content= Set back on a hill along historic Route 6A, 2&3 room suites and outdoor pool. Refrigerators, phone, cable, and A/C.
content=Dennisport. Glass-enclosed pool, outdoor pool, sauna & jacuzzi. Motel rooms, kitchenettes, & cottages. Five minute walk to beach.
name=The Corsair & Cross Rip Oceanfront Motels
content=Dennisport MA 02639. Private beach, indoor heated pool with game rooms, 2 outdoor pools, 2 outdoor whirlpools. Most units have 2 queen beds with kitchenettes.
, P.O. Box 127, Dennisport, +1 508-398-3615. Sea Captain's Homes on Cape Cod's Nantucket Sound.
content=West Dennis. Year round. Family owned and operated. Rooms, some efficiencies. Pool.

content=Accommodations include cottages, carriage house, and a lodge. Amenities include pool, private bath, air conditioning, refrigerators, in-room safe, television, data-port, and hairdryers. Located near beaches, golf courses, hiking/biking trails, and shopping.
name=The Old Landing Motel at Sea Street Beach

content=Old Wharf Road, Dennis Port. Beachfront.

, one of the villages of Barnstable, boasts the largest downtown area in the mid-Cape, as well as the Cape Cod Mall, the largest mall on the Cape.  Main Street is lined with ice cream parlors, restaurants, salt water taffy shops, bars, art galleries, and lots of souvenir shops.  Although some say it has gotten tackier in recent years, it is still worth a visit.

A bit farther out from Dennis is

, located at the tip of the Cape.  Arguably the gay capital of the Northeast, Provincetown is home to a wide array of shops, art galleries, bars, bed & breakfasts, and particularly good restaurants.  While the cobblestone streets can get a bit raucous at night, it is far and away the most vibrant town in the area and still retains the antique charm of Cape Cod.  Definitely worth a visit.
